item.description:
Please RSVP!

TITLE: CAN SLIM (TM) and Investing the IBD (TM) Way: What it is, why it works and how to use it - by Mike Kinkead

DESCRIPTION: Mike continues his series on investing the IBD way using William J. O'Neil's CAN SLIM® approach. Investing is about playing the probabilities. Thanks to O'Neil, we know what these probabilities are and how to use them to select winning stocks.

The May talk will focus on the S (Supply and Demand) and I (Institutional Sponsorship - the elephants who are responsible for driving price up or down) in CAN SLIM®. You will learn:

  • How low float, coupled with sufficient average daily volume, raises the probability of choosing a high performance stock.
  • How and why institutional buying volume helps you time your buys and avoid dead money.
  • What daily, weekly and monthly routines help you spot and understand the actions of the elephants.

Due to the importance of earnings and earnings anticipation in driving stock price, there will be a section of the May talk devoted to finding more fundamentally strong stocks, and, if Mr. Market continues to co-operate, another stock pick of the week.

This is the second in a series of interactive talks with Mike Kinkead at the Wednesday Boston IBD Meetup. Everyone is encouraged to contribute his or her experience and expertise to the discussion.

IBD Group Rate for Upcoming Level 1 Seminar!

As a effort to help members get started on their own journey learning the IBD (TM) Method, we have secured a special offer from IBD for 50% off on the June 28 seminar in Boston! To learn more, go to this link: http://files.meetup.c...


Market Talk led by Doug Roberts

Doug has delivered his Market Talk ever since we moved to MIT. The banter in our group of bulls versus bears has become vigorous as the market alternately rallies and tumbles. Join this discussion as Doug gives his perspective on fundamentals, technicals and sentiment. Doug is one of the leaders of the group and is a full-time trader.

BOSTON TIGER PRE-MEETING Announcement:
The Boston Tiger Meeting of the Tiger Financial Network meets during the hour from 6:00 PM to 6:50 PM. Go to http://www.tfnn.com/b... to see the full announcement. For questions, see Bob Pod at bpodd@softwareresults.com. The meeting is the same room as the 7:00 meeting.

The agenda for the meetup will be:
6:00 - 6:50 Pre-Meeting with Boston Tigers, led by Bob Podd
7:00 Introduction, Announcements, Polls by Doug
Market Talk and Discussion led by Doug
Stockpicks led by Chris
CAN SLIM (TM) and Investing the IBD (TM) Way: What it is, why it works and how to use it led by Mike

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....
or send email to DouglasWRoberts@gmail.com.

In order to identify people who evidence expertise in particular interests we have virtual trading.
To join in our virtual trading, go to this link for instructions and signup links:
http://groups.google....

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

Make your own investment decisions! Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone but you.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: The Boston Investor's Business Daily Wednesday Meeting
